title: Arrests made in fatal Dec. 6 shooting at Raceland house party
content:
Two people have been arrested in connection with a Dec. 6 shooting in Raceland that left one man dead and three others injured, the Lafourche Parish Sheriff's Office reported Wednesday (Dec. 30).
Kendell Thibodeaux Jr., 21, is booked with second-degree murder in the death of Tra'von Folse, 20, Sheriff Craig Webre said. Thibodeaux is also booked with attempted murder, along with Jordan Williams, 23.
According to the Sheriff's Office, deputies received calls around 12:45 a.m. Dec. 6 that multiple people had been shot during a house party at a home on Market Street. Folse was shot in the abdomen and was taken to a local hospital where he later died.
A 23-year-old man was shot in the neck and arm, a 20-year-old man was shot in the buttocks, and a 24-year-old man was shot in the neck, authorities said.
Thibodeaux has been in jail since Dec. 18 because of a parole violation.
On Monday, he punched an inmate in the face, rendering him unconscious, the Sheriff's Office said. Thibodeaux was booked with second-degree battery. He was booked Tuesday on the murder charge and being a felon in possession of a firearm.
Williams, also booked with being a felon in possession of a gun, was arrested Tuesday night after leading deputies on a chase from a truck stop in Larose, the Sheriff's Office said. He also faces charges in connection with that incident.
